tool.name: Visualize Markers with MuData

configfiles.configfile: import scanpy as sc import muon as mu mdata = mu.read_h5mu('$rna_atac_input') mdata['rna'].obs['celltype_joint'] = mdata.obs.celltype mdata['atac'].obs['celltype_joint'] = mdata.obs.celltype marker_genes = ['IL7R', 'TRAC', 'GATA3', 'LEF1', 'FHIT', 'RORA', 'ITGB1', 'CD8A', 'CD8B', 'CD248', 'CCL5', 'KLRB1', 'SLC4A10', 'IL32', 'GNLY', 'NKG7', 'CD79A', 'MS4A1', 'IGHD', 'IGHM', 'IL4R', 'TNFRSF13C', 'KLF4', 'LYZ', 'S100A8', 'ITGAM', 'CD14', 'DPYD', 'ITGAM', 'FCGR3A', 'MS4A7', 'CST3', 'CLEC10A', 'IRF8', 'TCF4'] rna_marker_genes = sc.pl.dotplot(mdata['rna'], marker_genes, 'celltype_joint', save="rna_marker_genes.png") marker_peaks = [ 'chr14:99255246-99275454', 'chr10:33135632-33141841', 'chr1:1210271-1220028', 'chr2:86783559-86792275', 'chr12:10552886-10555668', 'chr11:114072228-114076352', 'chr5:150385442-150415310', 'chr22:41931503-41942227', 'chr22:41917087-41929835', 'chr6:167111604-167115345', 'chr9:107480158-107492721', 'chr5:1476663-1483241', 'chr10:75399596-75404660', 'chr1:220876295-220883526', 'chr17:81425658-81431769', 'chr7:98641522-98642532',] sc.pl.dotplot(mdata['atac'], marker_peaks, 'celltype_joint', save="atac_marker_peaks.png") mdata.write("rna_atac_marker_genes_peaks.h5mu")

data.name: rna_atac_marker_genes_peaks
data.label: RNA ATAC with Marker Genes and Peaks

tool.help:
**What it does** This tool takes a multimodal data matrix then visualises marker genes across cell types for the RNA modality and visualises marker peaks across celltypes for the ATAC modality.
It returns a dotplot as a png for each modality and the multimodal data matrix after processing.
